title: Juggling a Mortgage and a Student Loan: Can You Really Do Both?
text:
4 Ways To Salvage Your Sorry Credit Score 
“Student debt isn’t the evil-doer it’s made out to be, at least not when it comes to homeownership." said Zillow Chief Economist Svenja Gudell. "As long as students stay in school and get a degree, student debt doesn’t deter them from homeownership.” 
Zillow doesn’t delve into any changes in underwriting that may have taken place since the 2008 financial crisis. It also doesn’t seem to take location, location and location into account—the market in Seattle is very different than that in Detroit. Also, Zillow is only looking at those who aim to buy homes. The number of people with student loans who have delayed plans to buy a house isn’t calculated. 
In fact, a June 3 post on the advice thread on Zillow's website argued that student loan debt and housing debt just don’t mix. "If you are currently adding debt, now probably isn't the best time to buy a house," said real estate agent Karlton Press, a foreclosure and short sale specialist at Keller-Williams Classic Realty in Orlando. “Get out of school, pay off the debt…save up an emergency fund, then a down payment and then by the house.” 1
